timeline.bodyText: I think quickly cycling the handler (initialize->dispose->initialize) would cause multiple Coordinator instances to be created simultaneously and also lose track of one of them.
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Okay. Calling the coordinator.initialize() method asynchronously and keep the instance creating like before should work either.
replies.author: cweitkamp

replies.bodyText:
Only if coordinator.initialize() is synchronized along with coordinator.destroy() as well as adding an early exit in coordinator.initialize() if coordinator.destroy() was called first.
I think that would make it thread safe.
replies.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: @cweitkamp Do you have this PR still on your radar?
replies.author: kaikreuzer

replies.bodyText: @kaikreuzer Thanks for the reminder. I updated the PR with the suggested solution above.
